Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: தம்மின்தம் மக்கள் அறிவுடைமை மாநிலத்துமன்னுயிர்க் கெல்லாம் இனிது.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: That their children should possess knowledge is more pleasing to all men of this great earth than to themselves.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: Parents looking at their child, who is demonstrating a piece of wisdom or skill that clearly surpasses their own. The parents' faces are filled with a profound, selfless joy.
Layered_Composition.Midground: From this family scene, waves of golden, joyous energy emanate outwards.
Layered_Composition.Background: These waves of joy wash over the entire world ('மாநிலத்து மன்னுயிர்க் கெல்லாம்'). A diverse group of people from all walks of life—farmers, kings, merchants, sages—are shown stopping their activities to smile with a shared, universal pleasure as they witness the child's wisdom.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The joy felt when a child surpasses their parents in wisdom is not just a private family pleasure, but a universal delight that pleases all of humanity.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The shared, universal joy is the key visual. The waves of pleasure are a tangible force that connects the family to the rest of the world. The joy of 'all beings' is genuine and spontaneous.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Universal joy, selfless pleasure, collective happiness, sweet.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A warm, golden, joyous light originates from the child's act of wisdom and spreads to illuminate the entire world. The palette is bright, warm, and universally positive.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Epic high-angle shot, starting close on the family and pulling back to reveal the waves of joy spreading across the entire world.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, capturing a wide diversity of human figures all sharing the same emotion.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Radiant, spreading light to symbolize the contagious nature of this particular joy.

Cultural_Anchors: Children surpassing parents in wisdom (தம்மின் தம் மக்கள் அறிவுடைமை)
A sweet thing for all beings on earth (மன்னுயிர்க் கெல்லாம் இனிது)
